title: A lot of champion movement delays in game SINCE THE NEW PATCH
body:
Hello. I was wondering if other people were having same problems as me and wanted to discuss upon the matter.

My laptop is fine. My internet is fine (its not even wifi. Its ethernet). And I never had these problems before EVER.

It feels like Im playing from another region. It feels like I have 150-200 ping. This isnt permanent but happens very often and its also random.

I have tried many "fix" options such as disabling the Xbox DVR thingy, redownloading the client, and updating my graphic programs, etc

It just feels like I am being punished at this point. Having fine internet and computer and I have to still play with this insanely annoying delay.

If anyone knows how to fix this problem or even would like to just discuss this issue, would be greatly appreciated. Thanks.

And I would love to downgrade to Windows 7 but the time for reset is over.. so only options are buy windows 7 or factory reset (which I rather not 

do just because of 1 game having issues.)

replies.body: Can you describe the delay a bit more? There are a lot of things that can be causing this, but it depends on the specific symptoms.

sure. thanks for replying

When I right click the character to move from 1 point to another, Its not instant or matched with the normal speed limit of my ping (55ms).

The character (champion) just stands still for (if short) 1 - 2 or most of the time (long) 3-5 seconds and THEN moves to the place I right clicked.

Again as I stated above, the ping or FPS does not go down at all. Computer and Internet is fine. 

I have seen some people make a thread about it in the 6.22 bug thread on Reddit. They have the exact same problem I have and apparently

only way to "fix" the issue as of moment is to go back to windows 7 (which is a lot of hassle)

I'm not convinced this is directly related to your OS. The symptoms you've mentioned are common to *Packet Loss* issues, which are directly related to routing issues to our servers. I'd like you to work through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure your local network settings are compatible with League before we investigate into this further.

Let me know if those steps caused any change.
